author: killari.
content: hey. I want to understand more about what blob transactions inputs are and what they can do. Is there some documentation about them? They contain `data`, `value` and `to` field. So I guess you can send a blob, attach eth and also execute contract as well?

author: killari.
content: is the blob payload valid already for that contract execution?

author: __flcl
content: It's a regular transaction, a contract can be called with data passed, and balances may be changed, but you can't create contracts with it, `to` **must** be set

author: __flcl
content: Another difference is that you can access blob versioned hashes from code.

author: killari.
content: can you access the blob that you create on that transaction?

author: __flcl
content: Only its versioned hash, not a bit of actual blob data

author: killari.
content: okay, so then it would make sense to add blobs to `eth_call` is there spec for that?

author: __flcl
content: Hm it seems like it's already there https://github.com/ethereum/execution-apis/blob/431cf72fd3403d946ca3e3afc36b973fc87e0e89/src/schemas/transaction.yaml

author: __flcl
content: Referenced in https://github.com/ethereum/execution-apis/blob/431cf72fd3403d946ca3e3afc36b973fc87e0e89/src/eth/execute.yaml#L1

author: killari.
content: okay thank you!

author: killari.
content: hmm, that takes in just versioned hashes. Eventhought when you send such transaction, you need to include the actual blobs

author: killari.
content: so the API is different to transaction sending?

author: __flcl
content: Not sure why, may be to confirm their validity. EL can validate blobs have correct data(you cannot post any data via blobs, there are limitations), and also calculate hashes from them to compare

author: __flcl
content: You can send blob transaction vis eth_sendrawtransaction, all stuff should be sent there in rlp format, including blobs, commitments and proofs

author: killari.
content: hmm, `eth_sendTransaction` doesn't have support for blobs?

author: __flcl
content: Yes, and I don't expect it will be

author: killari.
content: hmm, why not?

author: __flcl
content: Why do you need it?

author: killari.
content: so you can request to send such transaction

author: __flcl
content: https://github.com/ethereum/execution-apis/blob/431cf72fd3403d946ca3e3afc36b973fc87e0e89/src/eth/submit.yaml#L1 actually use the same structure as for eth_call, so I guess some EL may actually handle it

author: killari.
content: just with the hashes, not with the full blob data thought ðŸ¤”

author: __flcl
content: Actually it has blobs: https://github.com/ethereum/execution-apis/blob/431cf72fd3403d946ca3e3afc36b973fc87e0e89/src/schemas/transaction.yaml#L414

author: killari.
content: I am asking about this, as I am working with `eth_multicallV1` and we are adding support for blobs. And I am not sure on what the API should look like

author: killari.
content: hmm still `commitments` and `proofs` are missing from that

author: killari.
content: as when sending a raw transaction, those are also needed

author: __flcl
content: Nice question! Yes,  but in theory you can generate them from blobs on el side, let me ask the team about that.
